description: Should Spence buy the Mac Studio M3 Ultra? Data-driven analysis of API costs, rate limits, system resources, and workflow throughput.

panels.title: Est. Monthly API Spend
panels.description: Current hourly rate √ó 720 hours. Green <$300, yellow $300-700, orange $700-1500, red >$1500.

panels.title: Rate Limit Hit Rate
panels.description: Percentage of API requests getting 429 rate limited. >5% means API bottleneck ‚Äî Mac Studio won't help.

panels.title: Peak RAM Usage
panels.description: Maximum RAM utilization in the selected time range. >80% = memory bottleneck = Mac Studio JUSTIFIED.

panels.title: Avg API Latency
panels.description: Average API request round-trip time. High latency + high cost = local inference argument.

options.content:
### Decision Logic

| Signal | Meaning |
|--------|--------|
| üî¥ Rate Limit >5% | **API bottleneck** ‚Äî Mac Studio won't help |
| üî¥ RAM >80% | **Memory bottleneck** ‚Äî Mac Studio JUSTIFIED |
| üü° Cost >$1k/mo | **Cost pressure** ‚Äî local inference may save $$ |
| üü¢ All green | **No bottleneck** ‚Äî stay on cloud |

## üñ•Ô∏è Should Spence Buy the Mac Studio M3 Ultra?

### Mac Studio M3 Ultra Specs: 512GB unified RAM, 16TB SSD, 80-core GPU ‚Äî $10,000
### Current System: Apple M4 Pro, 64GB RAM, 1TB SSD

---

**Buy Signals (any one = strong case):**
- RAM consistently >80% ‚Äî you're swapping and agents are fighting for memory
- Monthly API spend >$1,000 AND most cost is from small/fast model calls that local inference could handle
- Concurrent agent count regularly hits ceilings due to resource constraints

**Don't Buy Signals:**
- Rate limit hit rate >5% ‚Äî your bottleneck is Anthropic's API, not your hardware
- RAM <60% ‚Äî your current 64GB is plenty
- Most cost is from Opus-class calls ‚Äî local models can't replace these anyway
- API latency is your main bottleneck ‚Äî faster hardware doesn't fix network round trips

**The ROI Math:**
- Mac Studio = $10,000 one-time
- Break-even if local inference saves >$400/mo for 25 months
- Or if RAM bottleneck costs you >2 hours/week of productivity ($200/hr √ó 50 weeks = $10k/year)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Docker Desktop Note:** System metrics (CPU/RAM/disk) reflect the Docker VM, not the Mac host directly. Increase Docker Desktop memory allocation for more realistic pressure testing. API cost/rate limit data is fully accurate regardless.

panels.title: Token Usage Over Time
panels.description: Input, output, and cache read tokens per 5-minute window. High cache read = efficient prompt caching.

panels.title: API Cost Per Hour
panels.description: Hourly API cost by model. Stacked to show total. Red threshold at $5/hr ($3,600/mo).

panels.title: Cost Breakdown by Model
panels.description: Total cost per model in selected time range. Shows where the money goes.

panels.title: Rate Limit Events (429s)
panels.description: Each bar = one rate limit hit. If this is lighting up, you're API-bottlenecked and the Mac Studio won't help.

panels.title: n8n Executions / Hour
panels.description: Workflow execution throughput. If this is flat-topping, you're throughput-bottlenecked.

panels.title: Workflow Execution Duration
panels.description: How long workflows take. Orange at 60s, red at 180s. Long durations = agent bottleneck.

panels.title: n8n Queue Depth
panels.description: Pending workflow executions. High queue = throughput bottleneck.

panels.title: Concurrent API Requests
panels.description: In-flight API requests by agent. Shows concurrency ceiling.

panels.title: CPU Utilization
panels.description: Total CPU usage across all cores. Orange >80%, red >95%. M4 Pro has 12 cores (10P + 2E).

panels.title: RAM Usage ‚Äî Docker VM (Mac Studio Threshold at 80%)
panels.description: Docker Desktop VM memory usage with 80% threshold. NOTE: On Docker Desktop for Mac, node-exporter sees the VM's allocated RAM, not the host's 64GB. Increase Docker Desktop memory allocation to see more realistic pressure data. For true host RAM, check Activity Monitor.

panels.title: Disk I/O
panels.description: Disk read/write throughput. High sustained I/O during agent runs = local SSD matters.

panels.title: Network Throughput
panels.description: Network rx/tx. Relevant for API-bound workloads ‚Äî if you're saturating bandwidth, that's another data point.

panels.title: Swap Used
panels.description: Swap usage in GB. Any swap usage on macOS = memory pressure = Mac Studio argument.

panels.title: Per-Agent Summary
panels.description: API usage breakdown by agent. Identifies which agents are the biggest spenders.

panels.title: Concurrent Agents Over Time
panels.description: How many agents are making API calls simultaneously. Higher concurrency = more RAM needed for context windows.

panels.title: Service Memory Usage
panels.description: Resident memory per service (from Prometheus /metrics endpoints). Shows which services are the biggest memory consumers.

panels.title: Service CPU Usage
panels.description: CPU time per service (from Prometheus /metrics endpoints). Docker VM total shown separately.

title: Claude Dev Factory ‚Äî Buy the Mac Studio?
